Notes: The programmable workhorse of high-volume law. Users script their own workflows in a proprietary language. Incredibly ugly, but automates document production like nothing else.
The twin titan to Idox, but for social services. It holds the "case" of a vulnerable child. Massive statutory reporting requirements make it immovable from Councils.
The "Salesforce" of UK property. It connects the front office (sales) with the back office (compliance). Acquisitive and dominating, but users feel trapped by the ecosystem.
Direct rival to Tramps. Used by big London managing agents. It is an accounting engine wrapped in a property database. Migrations take years.
Legacy desktop software for nursing homes. It replaced paper binders. Very rigid, form-based UI that ensures care homes pass CQC inspections.
Manages the "case" of a boiler repair or electrical install. Birmingham-based success story. Replaces whiteboards in trade offices.
The premium version of Bromcom/SIMS. strictly for fee-paying schools. Handles the "case" of a pupil, plus billing parents for fees. Very specific academic logic.
The desktop-heavy standard for recruitment agencies before the cloud took over. Now hosted, but retains a very "grey" data-dense interface loved by power users.
The main rival to SDM/Northgate. It runs the waiting lists and rent accounts for large Housing Associations. A massive, modular beast.
The "case" is a client's tax return. Loved by small high-street accountants. It validates data against HMRC rules. Very sticky because it holds historical tax data.
The cloud challenger to Redbrick/Osprey. Focuses purely on moving a house sale through the legal chain. Heavy integration with Land Registry search providers.
The modern web-based killer of Exact. It manages the clinical chart and the appointment book. Gaining ground, but Exact's NHS pipework keeps it in check.
Niche transport logic. It analyses driver logs to ensure they haven't driven too many hours (legal compliance). A pure data-crunching engine.
Web-based PMS for vets. Manages the animal's clinical history and the owner's bill. Integrates with wholesalers for drug ordering.
The modern challenger to Harlequin. Built for UK Gift Aid rules. It manages the "case" of a donor relationship. Much fresher UI than the legacy players.
Used by physios, psychotherapists, and speech therapists. It manages patient notes and GDPR consent. Very modular, simple "clinical" workflow.
Originally a Xero add-on for landlords. It manages the workflow of tenancies and repairs. Recently bought by MRI to capture the SME market.
Mobile-first system for care workers to tap icons when they deliver care. Replaces the "Daily Log" at the end of a bed. High volume data capture.
Manages the "case" of a limited company. Connects to Companies House to file confirmation statements. Niche, but essential for accountants.
Focuses heavily on the plumbing/heating trade. Handles the complex workflow of gas safety certificates. Replaces the diary and the invoice pad.
